(m. 1996â2002, divorced) }} '''Mia Sara''' (born June 19, 1967) is an American [[actress]] best known for her roles as Ferris Bueller's girlfriend, Sloane Peterson, in ''[[Ferris Bueller's Day Off]]'', as [[Jean Claude Van Damme]]'s wife Melissa Walker in ''[[Timecop]]'', and as Lily, playing opposite [[Tom Cruise]] in ''[[Legend (film)|Legend]]''. ==Early life== Born Mia Sarapocciello, in [[Brooklyn Heights, Brooklyn|Brooklyn Heights]], New York City to Jerome, a photographer and artist, and Diana, a stylist and also a photographer,{{cite web|url=http://www.filmreference.com/film/7/Mia-Sara.html|title=Mia Sara Biography (1967â)|accessdate=2009-07-27|publisher=''Filmreference''}} she attended [[Saint Ann's School (New York City)|St. Ann's School]], in [[Brooklyn]], [[New York City]].{{cite web |url=http://news.google.com/newspapers?id=RwwhAAAAIBAJ&sjid=UXIFAAAAIBAJ&pg=2398,6225614&dq=mia-sara&hl=en |title=Mia Sara Lands Plum Roles Despite Lack of Training |first=Vernon |last=Scott |date=1986-07-25 |work=Schenectady Gazette |accessdate=2011-02-12}} ==Career== Sara's first major role was as Princess Lily, playing opposite [[Tom Cruise]] in ''[[Legend (film)|Legend]]''. Her popular role came as Ferris' girlfriend, Sloane in the 1986 film ''[[Ferris Bueller's Day Off]]''. She also appeared in the miniseries ''[[Queenie (miniseries)|Queenie]]'', a [[Roman Ã  clef|roman-Ã -clef]] on actress [[Merle Oberon]],{{cite web |first=Michael E. |last=Hill |url=http://news.google.com/newspapers?id=tUEdAAAAIBAJ&sjid=gKcEAAAAIBAJ&pg=2961,5011628&dq=mia-sara&hl=en |title=Mia Sara drops teen act for "Queenie" |work=Anchorage Daily News |date=1987-05-10 |accessdate=2011-02-12}} as well as 1992's ''[[A Stranger Among Us]]'', directed by [[Sidney Lumet]]. For ''[[Timecop]]'', she won the [[Saturn Award]] for [[Saturn Award for Best Supporting Actress|Best Supporting Actress]].{{cite web |url=http://www.saturnawards.org/past.html#filmsuportactress |title=Past Saturn Awards : Film Awards : Best Supporting Actress |publisher=The Academy of Science Fiction, Fantasy & Horror Films |accessdate=2011-02-12}} Her television roles have included playing Annie Knox in the [[science fiction]] series ''[[Time Trax]]'' and [[Harley Quinn|Dr. Harleen Quinzel]] in the short-lived [[The WB Television Network|WB Network]] [[superhero]] show ''[[Birds of Prey (TV series)|Birds of Prey]]''. ==Personal life== Sara enjoys flying and holds a private pilot license. In March 1996, Sara was married to [[Jason Connery]], the son of [[Sean Connery]], with whom she performed in ''[[Bullet to Beijing]]''. In June 1997, they had a son, Dashiell Quinn Connery. The couple divorced in 2002.{{cite web|url=http://www.jasonconnery.com/bio.htm|title=JASON CONNERY â The Official Site|accessdate=2009-07-27|publisher=''Jason Connery''}} She is in a relationship with [[Brian Henson]], son of [[Muppet]] creator [[Jim Henson]], with whom she has a daughter.{{cn|date=October 2011}} ==Filmography== {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 90%;" |-style="background:#B0C4DE;" !
